oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - American Ace - 1947-12-06 - Part 3 // Purina - 1947-12-06 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 3 of excerpts from an American Ace sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (7:30-8:00 pm) from December 6, 1947. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, the Tennessee Belles, Tommy Jackson, Uncle Dave Macon, Pap's Jug Band, Sonny Day, and Bashful Brother Oswald. Followed by part 1 of excerpts from a Purina sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (8:00-8:30 pm) from December 6, 1947. Featuring host/performer Eddy Arnold, with performers Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bashful Brother Oswald; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Tommy Jackson; Eddy Arnold; Bill Monroe; Blue Grass Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Bashful Brother Oswald talks -- Southern Moon (Bashful Brother Oswald) -- Roy Acuff talks -- I Saw The Light (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- Roy Acuff introduces Tommy Jackson -- McCloud's Reel (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- American Ace Coffee commercial (Grant Turner) -- Closing theme (Ida Red) -- Closing statement (Roy Acuff) -- Network/station announcement (Ernie Keller) -- Stephens Work Clothes commercial (George D. Hay) -- Opening statement (Ernie Keller) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement (Ott Devine) -- It Makes No Difference Now (Eddy Arnold) -- Eddy Arnold introduces Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys -- Molly And Tenbrooks (Bill Monroe and his Blue Grass Boys) (incomplete)
